intro: Hackelia diffusa, commonly known as the sticky monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking pink to purple tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its leaves are often glandular, producing a sticky substance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or open habitats. Hackelia diffusa is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
